meanings.definition: A fibrous protein found in the skin, bones, and connective tissues of animals.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that collagens help keep our skin and bones strong.
meanings.sent2: She learned in biology class that collagens are essential for healthy tissues.
meanings.sent3: The collagens in the body decided to have a party to strengthen their bonds.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the collagens in the body, providing structure and support.
meanings.sent5: The image of collagens weaving together like a strong rope stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: Any of a class of extracellular proteins rich in glycine and proline that are the main structural proteins in the extracellular matrix of connective tissues.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied how collagens contribute to the structure of tissues.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often consume foods rich in collagens to support their joints.
meanings.sent3: The collagens at the party were the life of the extracellular matrix.
meanings.sent4: His words were like collagens, forming a strong bond between them.
meanings.sent5: The collagens in the matrix intertwined like a beautiful dance of strength.
